content.body: What is a "promise-like object"? (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-promisecapability-records is the only occurrence in the spec)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: What is a "promise-like object"? (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-promisecapability-records is the only occurrence in the spec)

content.body: it deliberately doesn't have a formal definition
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it deliberately doesn't have a formal definition

content.body: formally it ends up being anything which can be produced by a constructor which takes a callback as an argument and immediately invokes that callback with two arguments, both of which are callable
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: formally it ends up being anything which can be produced by a constructor which takes a callback as an argument and immediately invokes that callback with two arguments, both of which are callable

content.body: so you should think of it as a promise-like object
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: so you should think of it as a promise-like object
